Hi Joel,

We spoke to Isentia about access to the Google Doc, we are told the doc contained the text below:

Isentia Connect - improving press release email delivery

There is a mechanism built into email delivery to reduce the incidence of spam, and if it is not set up correctly it results in legitimate emails being blocked. This affects both corporate email systems and cloud-based systems such as Office 365 and Gmail. This mechanism is called the Sender Policy Framework (SPF).

To make sure your press release emails are not affected you need your systems properly configured to tell all recipients of your press release emails that Isentia is authorised to send these emails on your behalf.

Unfortunately, this is not a setting Isentia can update for you. The setting must be made in your organisation's DNS records. The change is to add an SPF record to your DNS entries.

You need to request your IT administrator or service provider to either add Isentia's details to your existing SPF record or to create a new SPF record.

The details they will require from you are:

Adding to an existing SPF record

Add the following to the existing record.

include:http://spfx.isentia.com/

If you do not have an SPF record for your email domain

An SPF record must be created, and it must include the details of both your mail server and Isentia.

This is a TXT record in the following format:

v=spf1 ip4:<youremailserverIP> include:http://spfx.isentia.com/ ~all

Jayme Markus

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Team,

I'm getting in touch as Karlo is away today. We're currently working to configure our media monitoring platform, Isentia, to send media releases from the msaustralia.org.au domain.

We've been testing their system, but test emails (e.g. mmrelease@isentia.com) aren't coming through. After investigating with Isentia and our internal IT support, we've been advised that the issue is due to missing SPF and DKIM records on the domain.

Could you please assist by actioning the following as soon as possible?

SPF record

  • If an SPF record already exists, please add:
    include:spfx.isentia.com
  • If no SPF record exists, please create:
    v=spf1 ip4:<our-mail-server-IP> include:spfx.isentia.com ~all

(If you're unsure of our IP, the include line alone is fine.)

Reference:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Iu0oBQDPkt7rl1VOBCxl9-QWxmiLt5rrZJA8CI2XVK4/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.5nrw13ubr77r

DKIM record

  • Type: TXT
  • Name/Host: isentia._domainkey
  • Value:
    v=DKIM1; k=rsa; p=MIGfMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBAQUAA4GNADCBiQKBgQCbwPmkU+jqmylGMJAdS/Jzw5FUXn1erW20qlSA1ujqDtWpdMSviMNzSHSqOWAPjmyBfBOsEH9Z3g65o6JhzmJrDto4SPwZJBm5Zf/FHgp+Ayb1VevTGC8Uhg2E0CYC86sAWuC3DlPt/vm08Shcy6L12OzWnf21p3DlU0EWyBfvfQIDAQAB

Please let us know if this can be actioned from your end, or if you need anything further from us to proceed.

Sorry this was only brought to our attention today. We're hoping to send out a media release early Monday morning, so if this could be actioned urgently, it would be greatly appreciated.

Kind regards,


Jayme Markus
